title: 113_hr3695
content: There is no relevant information provided in the prev_chunk to summarize the curr_chunk. The authorities provided by the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008 will continue until January 31, 2014, with certain exceptions. Permanent price support authorities will be suspended until that date as well. The supplemental agricultural disaster assistance under the Federal Crop Insurance Act will apply until January 31, 2014. Exceptions include nutrition and conservation programs specified in relevant laws. The conservation stewardship program, farmland protection program, environmental quality incentives program, and wildlife habitat incentives program were extended through fiscal year 2014. Certain trade provisions are exempt from subsection (a) of the law. The use of Commodity Credit Corporation funds for the McGovern-Dole International Food for Education and Child Nutrition Program is exempt from certain provisions. Additionally, a survey of foods purchased by school food authorities and rural development funding are also exempt from subsection (a) of the law. Market loss assistance for asparagus producers is provided under various sections related to funding in different agricultural acts. Market loss assistance for asparagus producers is exempt from certain sections of agricultural acts related to disaster assistance and Pigford claims. The Heartland, habitat, harvest, and horticulture act of 2008 exempts certain agricultural disaster assistance provisions under the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008. This section becomes effective on September 30, 2013. The Heartland, habitat, harvest, and horticulture act of 2008 exempts certain agricultural disaster assistance provisions under the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008. Passed the House of Representatives on December 12, 2013.
